address: 339 Stockport Rd, Longsight, Manchester M12 4JE, United Kingdom

reviews.text: Hello, if there is something I can help and look into for you, please get in touch via our feedback form on the website https://newbank.nhs.uk/form/feedback/

I am writing to express my deep disappointment with the service I have received from New Health Bank over the past 8 months. Despite being promised a referral for surgery in November 2023, I have yet to receive any follow-up. Each time I ‚Ä¶More

Seriously, I dont know where to go for a genuine complaint, I am so annoyed with the service here, Every time my kids become ill I and my wife thinking how to deal with it, as this practice does not help at all. ‚Ä¶More

Hello Fazel, Thank you for taking the time to post your review. We appreciate any feedback we receive whether that be positive or negative as it helps us to improve the service we offer to patients. Due to the nature of your review, I am unable to comment specifically on the issues you raise. This is because doing so may breach your patient confidentiality. If you would like me to look into this issue further for you, please submit a feedback on the website here: https://www.newbank.nhs.uk/navigator/feedback/

should have the option of 0 stars! Doctors and nurses are fine but these arrogant reception staff needed to get their heads out their backsides! such rude ill mannered staff at the forefront of an establishment where people go out of no ‚Ä¶More
No routine appointment available. They said no more appointments for non emergencies.Its Disgusting. Not coprative staff at all.
Disrespectful staff no drinking facilities for patients. If ask from staff they just ignored, and suggest to buy from next door fuel pump. Not acceptable.

Hi Caitlin, I'm sorry to read that you are not happy with the service at the practice. If you would like me to investigate specific issues for you, please contact me via our feedback form https://newbank.nhs.uk/form/feedback/ which comes directly to me. I work at different sites which is why its easier to contact me this way. I hope I can help.

Hi Mohammed, thank you for taking the time to leave a review. I am sorry to read that you are unhappy with the service that you receive from the practice. If there is something you would like to investigate further, please complete a feedback form via website and I will look into it for you.

Hi Waseem, I am sorry that your are unhappy with the service you have received from New Bank Health Centre. Due to the this platform being public, I cannot discuss issues relating to your health in detail on here. If you would like me to investigate things further, please contact me via our feedback form on our website.

Hello Einass. Thank you for your review. We're sad to hear you feel our service is very bad. We're passionate about helping our community with their health so it is disappointing that you don't feel we're reaching that goal. We're always happy to take patient feedback on board. If you're looking to help us make improvements, the best way to do that is to join our Patient Participation Group. They are a group of people who are patients of the surgery and want to help it work as well as it can for patients, doctors and staff. They get together to bring different ideas to the surgery to help us treat patients better or to improve what we do in some way. If you would like to join our Patient Participation Group, fill out this form: https://bit.ly/3DJEGIZ
Hello Arslan. Thank you very much for your rating, we're so glad you're happy with the service you receive from us at New Bank Health Centre.

Hello Amina, I‚Äôm sorry to hear that your experience with our practice has not been great and you feel that our surgery should be shut down. Here at New Bank Health Centre, we operate a telephone triage policy. That means that every patient will get a telephone consultation first, and if it is deemed necessary by the doctor, they will then be offered a face-to-face appointment at the practice. Although this way of working may not be preferable for all patients, we have often found that it is successful and allows patients to get the treatment they need from the comfort of their own home. If you or your son have not been brought in to see the doctor in the surgery, this will have meant that they felt they could get a diagnosis of your medical problems and give you the treatment you need through the phone conversation. This is a nationally accepted way of working that many other practices in the UK use. We offer in-person blood test appointments at the practice every working day of the week. The only time we would offer appointments for patients at a different practice, would be if a patient isn‚Äôt able to attend during normal surgery hours, or if the next appointment that was available was in our Enhanced Access hours (6-8pm Monday ‚Äì Friday and 9am-5pm on Saturdays at The Robert Darbishire Practice) so I am afraid I have to disagree with your point that we always send patients to other practices. I am however very concerned about your son not being able to get his vaccinations and would like to look into this further for you. If you would like me to do that, please fill in a feedback form on our website. You can find it here: https://bit.ly/3nKUoOJ

Hello Lna. Thank you very much for your review . We're so glad to hear that you feel we're the best GP practice in Manchester and that you're always assisted by our staff members. We believe in trying to give patients quality service as quickly as possible and it's great that's what you've received. I have passed on your review to our team, I'm sure they will all really appreciate it.

Hello Pargat. Thank you for your review. We‚Äôre sorry to hear about the miscommunication you had recently with our practice. We understand that we do function a little bit differently here at New Bank Health Centre by operating a telephone triage system. This telephone triage system means that all patients will receive a phone call first, and if it is deemed necessary by the doctor, they will then be offered a face-to-face appointment at the practice. Although this way of working may not be preferable for all patients, we have often found that it is successful and allows patients to get the treatment they need from the comfort of their own home. Having a telephone consultation first should have been communicated with you when you were given an appointment. If it wasn‚Äôt then we do apologise.

Hi Michaela, thank you for your review. I'm sorry you feel you're being ignored when you submit an online form using our website. We have a policy that any forms to request an appointment should be responded to within 1 working day - other forms may have a slightly longer response rate but we do always aim to get back to you in a timely manner. If you would like me look into the forms you've submitted for yourself and your children, please do fill in a feedback form here: https://bit.ly/3C1zU9r

Hello Carole, thank you for your review. I‚Äôm saddened to hear that you feel members of our team discriminate against your mental health and that our receptionists hold our doctors to ransom. We care greatly about patients mental health and believe that looking after mental health is just as important and looking after physical health. That‚Äôs why our staff members are trained in mental health, and we also have dedicated mental health practitioners and a full wellbeing team in place to help patients. Regarding our receptionists, we can assure you that they do not hold our doctors to ransom. Our reception team are highly trained to deal with and triage patient requests, so they are passed over to the correct clinician or staff member. This in turn makes sure that the request is dealt with appropriately, and that each medical professional has all the information they need before the appointment so they can spend all the time in the consultation helping them.

Hello Shan. Thank you for your review. We appreciate any feedback we receive, whether that be positive or negative, as it helps us to improve the service we offer to patients. I'm sorry to hear that you feel like we're the worst surgery with the worst staff. Unfortunately, as your review doesn't contain many details I can't offer you an explanation on your circumstances. However, if you would like me to look into anything further for you, please fill in our feedback form with as much detail as possible. You can find the form here: https://bit.ly/3zQERQD

Hello Anila. Thank you for your review, we appreciate any feedback we receive whether that be positive or negative as it helps us to improve our service. It‚Äôs a shame that you feel we‚Äôre a pathetic surgery and that doctors don‚Äôt even bother to call you and ask the issue. Here at New Bank Health Centre, we operate a telephone triage system. This telephone triage system means that all patients will receive a phone call first, and if it is deemed necessary by the doctor, they will then be offered a face-to-face appointment at the practice. We also allow our clinicians to contact patients via the online forms they submit, however, this should only be for simple problems and anything more complex should receive a phone call. If you did not receive any form of communication, it will either be because something went wrong or there were no appointments left for the day. If you would like me to look into this further for you, please fill in a feedback form on our website. You can find it here: https://bit.ly/3nKUoOJ

Hello Gull. Thank you for your review. We appreciate any reviews we get whether they be positive or negative as they help us to improve the service we offer to patients. We appreciate that some patients do not like to use our online system, however, it is the quickest and easiest way for patients to request an appointment. If you aren't able to fill in a form online, our reception team will help you do that, just place a call to the practice. We understand that having your regular GP can be upsetting. If you would like to change your GP practice, you can find a new one that is close to you through the NHS website.

Phoned for appointment told to go online did this & waited all day for a call describing my symptoms of severe pain down my leg and numb foot was told sounds like a hernia ? In my leg really & phone was put down on me, phoned next day a ‚Ä¶More

Hi Jayne, thank you for your review. I'm sorry to hear you had a negative experience with us here at New Bank Health Centre. We do encourage patients who are able to use the internet to visit our website to fill in an online form. However, if a patient is unable to do so, we will fill in the form for them over the phone. Our reception team aren't able to book appointments and the online forms get assigned to the appropriate clinician. Unfortunately, our appointments are booked incredibly quickly, usually within the first few hours of the day, so if patients submit forms later on in the afternoon, it is unlikely we will be able to give them an appointment. We are a same day service and are unable to book appointments in advance. I‚Äôm afraid due to confidentiality laws, I am unable to respond on here to specific parts of your complaint. To do so would breach your medical confidentiality. If you would like me to look further into this incident for you, please do fill in a feedback form. You can the feedback form on our website here: https://bit.ly/3PAm4je We thank you for your feedback on our website. We are continually making improvements to make it easier for patients to use. If you are unable to remember your password, you should be able to reset your password using a link that will be located in one of our emails.

I requested a letter from GP and was not aware that this service will be charged as I never used this service before. Also no body informs me neither the GP or when I rang surgery they guy just simply said it‚Äôs ready for collection. When I ‚Ä¶More

Hello Videl. Thank you for your review, we appreciate any feedback we receive whether it be positive or negative. We're saddened to hear that you feel our team are rude and unhelpful, and that they aren't aware of how to treat patients with mental health problems. We're always working to improve the service we offer patients from staff members to ensure that they feel fully supported with all aspects of their health, including their mental health, and are in the process of developing further training for the team. Our intention is not to make anyone feel unheard or dismissed, and is instead to offer a caring and compassionate service. I would like to take a look into this issue for you, and to get to the bottom of what has happened in regards to your care. If you would like me to do that, please do fill in a feedback form on our website.

Hello Farah, thank you for your review. I'm sorry to hear that you feel we're an awful GP practice, and were struggling yesterday to get treatment from one of our doctors. Usually, we would only direct patients to use the services of a walk-in centre or NHS 111 if we did not have any appointments left and a patient felt like they needed to be seen that day. If they could wait, we would usually ask them to contact us the following day to book an appointment. I haven't been able to look into this for you as I can't find you under the name used on your review in our system. I would like to investigate this further to find out what happened yesterday and to see what went wrong. If you would like me to do that, please fill in a feedback form here: https://bit.ly/3AMLAvw

Hello Satvinder, thank you for your review. We‚Äôre saddened to hear you feel we‚Äôre a terrible GP Practice and that our staff ‚Äúdon‚Äôt want to work.‚Äù Please let me assure you that‚Äôs not the case. I apologise for taking a bit more time than usual to respond to your review. I did want to take a look into what happened so I can offer further information for you. I can completely understand your frustration about being passed over to pharmacy and not being given a GP appointment. However, we are obliged to use the Community Pharmacy Consultation Scheme (CPCS) mentioned in your review. The Community Pharmacy Consultation Scheme is a new national service to facilitate patients having a same day appointment for minor illnesses, or to get an urgent supply of a repeat medication. The service is designed to help alleviate pressure on GP appointments and emergency departments and so more people are able to get treatment quickly. I understand you may feel that the doctors here at New Bank Health Centre are avoiding patients, but please let me reassure you that is not the case. This is a scheme that has been put in place by the Government, and we have been instructed to use it by both the Government and NHS Greater Manchester Integrated Care, our governing body. Only specific pharmacies are involved in this scheme. This is why when you contacted Cohen‚Äôs pharmacy they said they were not responsible and when you visited them, they charged you for medication. Unfortunately, due to this being a public forum, I‚Äôm unable to give more details as it would breach confidentiality rules.

Hello Lukasz. Thank you for your review. We're sad that you feel you have had a bad experience with us here at New Bank Health Centre. Our reception team are trained to triage patient requests so they can make sure you get the correct help you need. We understand it may be frustrating to let them know your problem, but giving them this information will help them to assign your query to the right clinician or to deal with your issue efficiently. No requests that patients submit should be ignored, however, there are circumstances where a GP does not need to be involved. If you feel like a mistake was make in your case and you would like me to look into this further for you, please fill out a feedback form here: https://bit.ly/3bp2bbs.

Hello. We're sorry that you feel New Bank Health Centre is the worst GP in the UK and that the staff there are rude. We do always try our best to provide the best service and the highest level of care to patients that we possibly can. We appreciate that being prescribed the wrong medicine can be frustrating, we do hope that you have now managed to get the correct prescription. Unfortunately, the NHS is very stretched at the moment, and there are a lot of patients in the community that need our care. Because of this we do have strict appointment times we need to stick to and running over those appointment times would cause delays for other patients. If your appointment lasted the full duration, this may have been why Dr Singh did not have time to answer your questions. If that was not the case, and you would like me to look further into your recent experiences with us, please do let me know by filling out a feedback form here: https://bit.ly/3Fof8Ae

Hello Abz, thank you for your review. When it comes to the telephone, it is a first come first served system and unfortunately, we cannot control how many people call the surgery and how long the wait will be on the phone. Our team strive to get through the calls as quickly as possible, but sometimes the wait for patients will still be longer than everyone would like.

Hi Shalaw. We‚Äôre sorry you feel that the service we offer in New Bank Health Centre is very poor. So we can gain a better understanding of what happened in your recent experience with us, can you please fill out a feedback form on our website here (https://bit.ly/3xYlGB2) with more details?

Incompetent manager and staff. I have been in this country for 15 years, and this is the first surgery/health center who questions a EU ID card. They welcome new patients but they do make you unwelcome and they are unwilling to help. They ‚Ä¶More

very poor customer service. I joined with them in January 2015. they have my all previous medical records in their system. my previous gp transferred all my medical records to them. recently they denied me to provide all my previous records on a letter I requested. I am preparing for legal action.

Hopeless, they delete appointment requests, I've submitted 4 and still haven't been able to see a doctor. Had hoped it would improve under new management, but nope, still incompetent. I sent a detailed complaint about it last year and still no change. Passive aggressive staff replying to reviews blaming people and a doctor posting their own review lying about how great they are is just the tip of the iceberg. Over forty reviews here complaining about exactly the same problems, with no action from the practice.

Very bad experience with New Bank Health Centre. The staff are rude and unhelpful. They ignore patients, spend time chatting and laughing during working hours, and don‚Äôt take our concerns seriously. Every time ‚Ä¶More Photo 1 in review by Hamdah Al Raisi

reviews.reviewer: I'm extremely disappointed with the recent changes at this GP surgery. I had a blood test scheduled but was given a date I couldn‚Äôt attend. When I managed to make time, the appointment was cancelled due to "unforeseen circumstances." ‚Ä¶More
reviews.text: Klaudia Kania

The Worst GP in Manchester! I am extremely disappointed and frustrated with the service provided by this practice. The level of care and professionalism is shockingly poor, and I‚Äôm genuinely appalled by the way patients are treated. The staff are not only unhelpful but often rude and dismissive, making it incredibly difficult to get even the most basic appointment advice or simply book one. Trying to book an appointment is an absolute nightmare. Instead of making things easier for unwell patients, the process adds stress, anxiety, and frustration. You‚Äôre passed between phone lines, broken websites, and conflicting instructions; and still end up with no appointment. It feels like no one takes responsibility, and the entire system is set up to discourage people from accessing care.
Rating: 1/5 - Extremely DisappointingService Unfortunately, my experience at this clinic was very unpleasant. The behavior of ‚Ä¶More

The worst GP in Manchester. The appointments system is from 1965, where you have to wake up at 6am and file in the form online, or else they are closed by 8am. And then you sit until next day in pain without medication. ‚Ä¶More

If I could give zero stars, I would! This GP is so shameless, that they have now even time-limited sending admin requests and sick notes as well. Just like the appointments. They are open from 8am to hardly 10am or 11am. Who makes them think that we are available during those times when someone is sick or at work or commuting?? Instead of making it easy for sick patients to book appointments and requests at their convenience, they stress you out more, make you more anxious and sick. Horrible management! In Liverpool and London, almost all GPs have open appointment systems, you can book appointments online and choose your date and time. Admin requests, medical reports and sick notes are processed within 48 hours no questions asked and they even deliver medication to your house! But look at these guys, they are operating on biblical systems and it is 2025!! Do yourselves a favour and please open up your booking systems. Its not that hard. Stop being so shameless! I will be reporting this GP to Health Ombudsman, NHS and MP.
Unacceptable Service ‚Äì Disrespectful and Unprofessional. I am extremely disappointed and frustrated with the service provided by this GP. ‚Ä¶More

reviews.reviewer: Hello Moe. Thank you for your review. I'm sorry to hear you feel we are unprofessional. We feel patients should have control of their health and do encourage patients to manage their own care; this includes chasing your test results and submitting your own repeat prescriptions. We find this gives our doctors and nurses more time to see or speak to patients and to help them when they're feeling unwell. I am very concerned about your statement that we systematically discriminate you because of your disability. We pride ourselves on treating every patient equally so I would really like to investigate this point further. If you would be happy for me to take a look into your case, please submit a feedback form here https://bit.ly/3NdiJ6P. Kind Regards, Lauren, Engagement & Communications Officer

With that being said, I would be happy to take a look into this situation for you, and to get to the bottom of exactly what was said and why you weren't given an appointment that day. reviews.text: New Bank Health Centre (owner)

Hello George. Thank you for your review, we appreciate any reviews we receive whether they be positive or negative. We do understand that not all patients have internet access. That is why we have policies in place to offer further support to those who are digitally excluded, like taking appointment requests over the telephone etc. We appreciate that we do function a little bit differently here at New Bank Health Centre by operating a telephone triage system. This telephone triage system means that all patients will receive a phone call first, and if it is deemed necessary by the doctor, they will then be offered a face-to-face appointment at the practice. Although this way of working may not be preferable for all patients, we have often found that it is successful and allows patients to get the treatment they need from the comfort of their own home. If you have not been brought in to see the doctor in the surgery, this will have meant that they felt they could get a diagnosis of your medical problems and give you the treatment you need through the phone conversation. If you feel like you can no longer be a patient at our practice we do understand. To find a new GP practice, simply visit the NHS website. There you can search for a GP surgery using your postcode.

reviews.reviewer: Hello Al. Thank you for your review.
reviews.text: Here at New Bank Health Centre, we do operate a telephone triage system, where each patient will receive a telephone call. If the patient does not pick up on the first call, our policy is that the clinician will try them again no earlier than ten minutes later. If the patient still does not pick up, they will be asked to re-book an appointment for the following day. Whilst we understand your frustration, our practice has hundreds of patients who need our help each and every day, and we are not able to continuously call patients until they pick up. The only other circumstance that we allow our team to put the phone down on a patient is if they are being verbally abusive or aggressive. If none of these scenarios fit with your experience please do let me know by filling out a feedback form on our website and I will happily look into this for you.

This includes extending opening hours at a sister site so more patients are able to be seen each day, introducing new services like a full wellbeing team, physio team and in-house pharmacists that most practices don‚Äôt have, and having a same day service so patients don‚Äôt have to wait weeks to be seen. It's a shame you have decided to leave our practice, but I am glad that you feel you‚Äôre getting better care elsewhere.
